If you enjoy war movies and are interested in historical events, you might enjoy "The Alamo" (2004) starring Dennis Quaid and Jordi Mollà. This movie retells the story of the famous 1836 battle between Texan and Tejano forces and Mexican dictator Santa Anna's forces at the Alamo in San Antonio, Texas. Alternatively, if you're looking for a more recent war drama with a unique perspective, I recommend "Zero Dark Thirty" (2012) starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Duplass. This movie chronicles the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011. Both movies offer intense and thought-provoking storylines that I think you'll find engaging!
